<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 121, 378, 145]]<|/det|>
# Cambridge IGCSE™

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[620, 220, 720, 250]]<|/det|>
CANDIDATE NUMBER  

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[737, 212, 905, 256]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 348, 293]]<|/det|>
## ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 292]]<|/det|>
0606/22  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 156, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
May/June 2025  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 326, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 359, 400]]<|/det|>
No additional materials are needed.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 855, 604]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You should use a scientific calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.- For \(\pi\), use either your calculator value or 3.142.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 634, 213, 648]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 728, 682]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 80.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 107, 475, 127]]<|/det|>
Equation of a circle with centre \((a, b)\) and radius \(r\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[601, 102, 782, 125]]<|/det|>
\((x - a)^2 + (y - b)^2 = r^2\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 154, 631, 173]]<|/det|>
Curved surface area, \(A\), of cone of radius \(r\), sloping edge \(l\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[606, 154, 675, 172]]<|/det|>
\(A = \pi r l\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 202, 680, 221]]<|/det|>
Surface area, \(A\), of sphere of radius \(r\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[606, 201, 683, 220]]<|/det|>
\(A = 4\pi r^2\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 249, 680, 272]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of pyramid or cone, base area \(A\), height \(h\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[606, 245, 680, 272]]<|/det|>
\(V = \frac{1}{3} Ah\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 298, 680, 318]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of sphere of radius \(r\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[606, 293, 683, 318]]<|/det|>
\(V = \frac{4}{3}\pi r^3\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 346, 232, 365]]<|/det|>
Quadratic equation

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 345, 655, 365]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(ax^{2} + bx + c = 0\),

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 365, 561, 401]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 446, 225, 465]]<|/det|>
Binomial theorem

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 437, 907, 482]]<|/det|>
\((a + b)^{n} = a^{n} + \binom{n}{1} a^{n - 1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n - 2}b^{2} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} a^{n - r}b^{r} + \ldots +b^{n},\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 483, 771, 523]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n - r)!r!}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 553, 217, 571]]<|/det|>
Arithmetic series

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 552, 527, 571]]<|/det|>
\(u_{n} = a + (n - 1)d\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 571, 668, 600]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n} = \frac{1}{2} n(a + l) = \frac{1}{2} n\{2a + (n - 1)d\}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 631, 215, 650]]<|/det|>
Geometric series

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 630, 485, 650]]<|/det|>
\(u_{n} = ar^{n - 1}\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 650, 571, 685]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n} = \frac{a(1 - r^{n})}{1 - r} \quad (r \neq 1)\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 683, 549, 712]]<|/det|>
\[S_{\infty} = \frac{a}{1 - r} \quad (|r| < 1)\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 740, 156, 758]]<|/det|>
Identities

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 739, 534, 758]]<|/det|>
\(\sin^{2}A + \cos^{2}A = 1\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 756, 544, 775]]<|/det|>
\(\sec^{2}A = 1 + \tan^{2}A\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 772, 554, 791]]<|/det|>
\(\csc^{2}A = 1 + \cot^{2}A\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 829, 240, 848]]<|/det|>
Formulas for \(\Delta ABC\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 822, 576, 853]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C}\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 852, 576, 871]]<|/det|>
\[a^{2} = b^{2} + c^{2} - 2bc \cos A\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 871, 510, 902]]<|/det|>
\[\Delta = \frac{1}{2} ab \sin C\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 616, 89]]<|/det|>
In this question, all lengths are in metres and time is in seconds.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 918, 136]]<|/det|>
A particle \(P\) moves in a straight line such that its displacement \(s\) from a fixed point \(O\) at time \(t\) is given by \(s = (t - 4)^2 (t - 1)\) for \(t \geqslant 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 149, 144, 168]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 149, 860, 168]]<|/det|>
On the axes, sketch the displacement–time graph of \(P\), stating the intercepts with the axes. [2]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 178, 907, 528]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 540, 146, 558]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 540, 494, 558]]<|/det|>
Find an expression for the velocity, \(v\), of \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 555, 458, 573]]<|/det|>
Give your answer in a factorised form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 555, 917, 573]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 71, 818, 89]]<|/det|>
On the axes, sketch the velocity–time graph of \(P\), stating the intercepts with the axes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 71, 920, 88]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 102, 912, 428]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 440, 148, 459]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 440, 529, 459]]<|/det|>
Find an expression for the acceleration, \(a\), of \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 440, 920, 459]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 549, 144, 567]]<|/det|>
<label>(e)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 549, 850, 567]]<|/det|>
On the axes, sketch the acceleration–time graph of \(P\), stating the intercepts with the axes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 549, 920, 567]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 579, 912, 907]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 71, 92, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 364, 88]]<|/det|>
Functions f and g are such that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[354, 102, 559, 131]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{f}(x) = \frac{3x}{x + 4}\quad \mathrm{for} x > 0\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[354, 138, 571, 159]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{g}(x) = \sqrt{x + 2}\quad \mathrm{for} x > -2.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 172, 358, 191]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(\mathrm{fg}(x) = 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 173, 920, 191]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 81, 94, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 81, 143, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 77, 680, 102]]<|/det|>
Given that \(y = 4\sin 2x\cos 2x\), find the value of \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}}\) when \(x = \frac{\pi}{6}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 79, 920, 100]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[88, 400, 123, 419]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 403, 485, 425]]<|/det|>
A curve has equation \(y = 4\sin 2x\cos 2x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 432, 789, 460]]<|/det|>
The normal to the curve at the point where \(x = \frac{\pi}{6}\) meets the \(x\)-axis at the point \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 467, 405, 487]]<|/det|>
Find the exact coordinates of \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 467, 920, 486]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 751, 91]]<|/det|>
A 4-digit number is to be formed using the digits 0, 2, 4, 5, 6 and 8.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 87, 479, 106]]<|/det|>
The 4-digit number must **not** start with 0.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 102, 611, 121]]<|/det|>
Any digit may be used at most once in the 4-digit number.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 133, 180, 152]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 133, 569, 152]]<|/det|>
Find how many 4-digit numbers can be formed.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 133, 918, 152]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 210, 180, 228]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 210, 611, 228]]<|/det|>
Find how many even 4-digit numbers can be formed.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 210, 920, 228]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 350, 180, 368]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 350, 740, 368]]<|/det|>
Find how many 4-digit numbers that are divisible by 5 can be formed.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 350, 920, 368]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 535, 144, 554]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 535, 616, 554]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(\left(n + 1\right)\times {}^{n + 1}\mathrm{C}_{12} = 33\left(n - 10\right)\times {}^{n}\mathrm{C}_{10}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 535, 920, 554]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 698, 94]]<|/det|>
The volume, \(V,\) of a sphere is increasing at the constant rate of \(2\pi \mathrm{cm}^3 \mathrm{s}^{-1}\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 88, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
Find the rate of change of the surface area, \(S,\) of this sphere when the volume of the sphere is \(36\pi \mathrm{cm}^3.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 106, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 71, 92, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 71, 638, 91]]<|/det|>
The first three terms of an arithmetic progression can be written as

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[240, 100, 465, 121]]<|/det|>
\[2\ln \big(x^{3}\big), 5\ln \big(x^{2}\big), 2\ln \big(x^{7}\big).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 133, 146, 152]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 131, 920, 171]]<|/det|>
Given that \(x > 1\), find the least number of terms for the sum of this progression to be greater than \(43 \ln \left(x^{24}\right)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 153, 920, 171]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 71, 818, 88]]<|/det|>
Given that the 25th term of this progression is equal to 408, find the exact value of \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 71, 920, 88]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 87, 907, 400]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 420, 522, 452]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows part of the curve \(y = \frac{15}{x} - \frac{5}{x^2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 458, 442, 477]]<|/det|>
The curve meets the \(x\)-axis at the point \(A\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 472, 440, 491]]<|/det|>
The curve has a maximum at the point \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 518, 687, 539]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the shaded region enclosed by the line \(AB\) and the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 551, 371, 570]]<|/det|>
Give your answer in exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 551, 920, 570]]<|/det|>
<mark>[11]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 465, 91]]<|/det|>
Continuation of working space for Question 8.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 84, 106, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 79, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
The first three terms, in descending powers of \(x\), in the expansion of \(\left(3x^{2} - a\right)^{n}\left(1 + \frac{1}{x^{2}}\right)^{2}\) can be written as \(729x^{12} + 972x^{10} + bx^{8}\), where \(a, b\) and \(n\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 135, 346, 153]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a, b\) and \(n\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 135, 920, 153]]<|/det|>
<mark>[9]
